feeling nostalgic when I think of the days in high school.This indicates that the subject experienced a sense of nostalgia associated with the past, which caused a feeling of longing or yearning.

history:
friend: I just got an assigment.  I was doing well on it but rushed through the very end.  Now I'm not sure I'll be paid.
me: Why would you not get paid?
friend: I can no longer prove I did the assignment.  Computer work is for the birds sometim
me: I can see where you're coming from, and I'm sorry to hear that. I just want you to know that I'm here for you and that I'm willing to help you get through this.
friend: Thanks for understanding. I'm really glad you're there for me.

friend_mood: feeling trusting because their daughter's teenage boyfriend was in charge of taking care of their animals and home while they went on vacation. Luckily, he was a good young man, so they didn't worry he would try to steal anything. They felt it was safe and in good hands.
your_mood: Feeling nostalgic when I think of the days in high school, a bittersweet feeling washes over me, tinged with a sense of longing for the simpler times.
your_strategy: sharing, expressing care, questioning for details

me: Lucky! I would not trust anyone in my house!
friend: We didn't have much choice, as we had an outdoor dog and indoor cat, so if we didn't, we'd come back to not having pets. But, I wouldn't just let anybody, that's for su
.

friend_mood: feeling lonely because when my friend's sister passed away several years ago, he had such a hard time with the loss. He felt very much separate from others in dealing with his grief.
your_mood: Feeling nostalgic when I think of the days in high school.This experience evokes a sense of bittersweetness. The positive aspect is the cherished memories of learning and growing, while the negative aspect is the bittersweet reminder of leaving that chapter behind.
your_strategy: sharing own thoughts/opinion, expressing care or concern
history:
friend: My sister passed away several years ago. I really had a hard time with the grief and couldn't really relate to anyone that tried to help me with it.
me: i'm sorry to hear that. i know exactly what you are going through. My brother tragically passed away 2.5 years ago. He was only 32
friend: Yes, I'm sure you can relate as well. Ironically, that was the same age that my sister passed away. She took her own life, which my mother and I found her, and it was very hard for us all. But, I couldn't burden my parents with my pain, I fe
me: I'm so sorry to hear about the loss of your sister. I understand how difficult this must be for you.
friend: Thank you for being there for me. I really appreciate it.
me: I'm just trying to be there for you and let you know that I'm thinking of you.

Feeling nostalgic, I remember the days in high school. The hallways bustling with teenage energy, the laughter echoing through the corridors, and the camaraderie among our classmates. I feel a bittersweet pang of nostalgia, a bittersweet reminder of a chapter long gone.

me: I'm so proud of you, Grandpa! It's amazing that you were able to do that.
friend: Thanks, man! I'm glad you're proud of me. I hope you know that I'm lucky to have such an awesome grandpa in my life.

friend: I did! The company does something that I actually like -- a panel interview vs a series of one-on-ones. Have you ever had an interview like th
